      • pointInEllipse

        public static boolean pointInEllipse(java.awt.geom.Point2D pt,
                                     java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D rc)
        Checks whether the specified point is contained in the ellipse defined by the specified rectangle.

      • pointInPolygon

        public static boolean pointInPolygon(java.awt.geom.Point2D[] poly,
                                     java.awt.geom.Point2D ptTest)
        Determines if the specified point is within the specified polygon. It uses the classical polygon hit-testing algorithm: a horizontal ray starting at the point is extended infinitely rightwards and the number of polygon edges that intersect the ray are counted. If the number is odd, the point is inside the polygon.
        Returns:
        true if the point is inside the polygon, false if not.

      • pointInPolyRect

        public static boolean pointInPolyRect(java.awt.geom.Point2D[] poly,
                                      java.awt.geom.Point2D ptTest,
                                      java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D rBound)
        Determines if the specified point is within the smallest rectangle that encloses the specified polygon.
        Returns:
        true or false depending on whether the point is in the rect or not.

      • pointInRect

        public static boolean pointInRect(java.awt.geom.Point2D pt,
                                  java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D rc)

      • intersect

        public static boolean intersect(java.awt.geom.Point2D p1,
                                java.awt.geom.Point2D p2,
                                java.awt.geom.Point2D p3,
                                java.awt.geom.Point2D p4)
        Determines whether the specified line segments intersect.
        Returns:
        true if the segments intersect, or false otherwise.

      • ccw

        public static int ccw(java.awt.geom.Point2D p0,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D p1,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D p2)
        Determines, given three points, if when travelling from the first to the second to the third, we travel in a counterclockwise direction.
        Returns:
        1 if the movement is in a counterclockwise direction, or -1 otherwise.

      • normalizeRect

        public static java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D normalizeRect(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D rc)
        Normalizes the specified rectangle ensuring its height and width are non-negative numbers.
